result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasey L. Freeman

defendant.name: Freeman, Kasey L.
defendant.address: 38 S Water St W Apt 4, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF230 & 14CF264 called together at 2:20 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF230:
Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" & "Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty but Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2 & #3 and case 14CF264

Court orders Mr. Freeman committed to DHS for 3 years and orders DHS to prepare recommendation on if this shall be supervised release or in-patient, due in 45 days. Until that decision is made, Mr. Freeman to remain in community. 
Recess: 2:45 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule Hearing on DHS Commitment Recommendations 2/6/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on December 5, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Cases 14CF230 & 14CF264 called together at 11:13 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: 14CF230 had raised NGI plea - received report supporting NGI. Need additional time to discuss resolution with State. As to 14CF264 - did not enter NGI plea, but were waiting on findings in 14CF230 before discussing resolution of matters. Request additional DA PTC & STC be set.
ADA Shock: No objection
Court continues bond as set

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Schedule DA PTC 11/5/14 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 12/5/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Status conference on October 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Cases 14CF230 & 14CF264 called together at 8:57 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Freeman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered & "not guilty by reason by mental disease or defect" - on case 14CF230
--pleas of "not guilty" entered - 14CF264
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Freeman
Court appoints Dr. Freiburger to conduct examination in case 14CF230
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT:  BOTH CASES: (1) STC scheduled for 10/17/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF230 & 14CF264 called together at 8:44 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for Preliminary Hearing)
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that they will be requesting adjournment of the preliminary hearings in each matter. Mr. Freeman is seeking to retain private counsel and needs some time to do this. Not moving to withdraw at this time in case retainer falls through.
ADA Shock requests that since the State was prepared to move forward with preliminary hearing today and officer is present, that Officer costs be assessed for today's time. 
Court informs parties that officer costs should be added to any settlement form or assessed during sentencing.
Court reminds Mr. Freeman tha this bond/conditions of release remain in effect

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Reschedule Preliminary Hearing 9/5/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
Judge Weston presiding for Branch III Intake: 
Defendant Kasey L. Freeman appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within twenty days.

The Court requires a $250 cash bond, with conditions:
--not to operate a motor vehicle--Mr. Freeman is not to drive whether or not Mr. Freeman has a valid license
recess 1:40pm. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 8/15/14 at 8:30am.
